title: Variable atmosChem.mon.flashrate_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.flashrate)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "proposed name: lightning_flash_rate (units to be interpreted as 'counts km-2 s-1)";

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3ste_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.o3ste)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone. Set to ozone in the stratosphere, then destroyed in the troposphere using the ozone chemical loss rate. Please specify the tropopause definition used"; ; "modeling_realm" was "aerosol";
Comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone.
Long name: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.dms_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.dms)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.o3Clim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing notes: If O3 does not vary from one year to the next, report 12 months, starting with January.   (Note: include all 12 months even if the values do not vary seasonally.)  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as tro3Clim, not tro3. If the O3 varies from one year to the next,  then report instead the field described in the previous table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.o3)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing notes: If this does not change over time (except possibly to vary identically over each annual cycle), report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tclm-u-hm-u (Amon.n2oglobalClim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4globalClim, not ch4global.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:1.00E-09 CMIP7:mol mol-1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tavg-u-hm-u (Amon.n2oglobal)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.n2oClim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Processing notes: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as n2oglobal, not n2o.   If  N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.n2o)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Processing notes: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.hcfc22_tavg-u-hm-u (Amon.hcfc22global)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-12"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Modeling Realm - primary - CMIP6:atmos, atmosChem CMIP7:atmosChem, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample),

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.ch4_tclm-u-hm-u (Amon.ch4globalClim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";

Comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Processing notes: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the CH4 does not vary from one year to the next. If CH4 is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4 (see the table entry before the previous one).
